column1: What do you call a whore with a runny nose? full.
column3: Full can mean having no space left (first meaning) or can refer to having a runny nose (like being full of mucus).
column4: The container is full of water.
column5: He felt full after the heavy meal.

column1: Did you hear about the robbery at the bakery? the thieves said give me all your dough.
column3: Dough refers to the mixture for making bread or pastries (first meaning) and is also slang for money (second meaning).
column4: She kneaded the dough until it was smooth.
column5: He earned a lot of dough from his new job.

column1: Why could joseph never get anything done? because he was always stalin..
column3: Stalling refers to delaying or wasting time (first meaning), and it also plays on Joseph Stalins name (second meaning).
column4: He keeps stalling the meeting to avoid discussing the issue.
column5: The car was stalling because of engine trouble.

column1: Why did the tomato blush... he saw the salad dressing!
column3: Dressing refers to a sauce for salads (first meaning) and can also mean putting on clothes (second meaning).
column4: The salad needs some dressing for extra flavor.
column5: She is dressing for the formal event tonight.

column1: What did the female mushroom say about the male mushroom? hes a real fun guy.
column3: Fungi is the plural of fungus (first meaning) and fun guy sounds the same (second meaning).
column4: The fungi in the forest are fascinating to study.
column5: He is a fun guy who always knows how to make people laugh.
